revised_title: Protein Structure Adaptation to Amino-Acid Sequence Changes
tldr: The article discusses the relationship between amino-acid sequence changes and the resulting structural changes in proteins. It introduces the concept of a 'core' structure, which retains the basic folding pattern of related proteins, and explores how the divergence of protein structures is related to the divergence of their amino-acid sequences. The study provides insights into model building of unknown protein structures and has implications for understanding protein evolution.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Structural Biology
